boat.name: Rosenn
boat.full_description:
An 1896 Solent One-Design, believed to be a White Bros. of Itchen build, 'Rosenn' is the last known survivor of her class. She has been completely professionally re-built and restored 2009-2010 to the highest specification, coated with epoxy inside and out and finished with epoxy paint and varnish.

She has an excellent racing record with successes too many to list.
boat.construction_details: Carvel Pitch Pine on sawn and bent oak frames
boat.short_description: Believed to be a White Bros. of Itchen build, 'Rosenn' is the last known survivor of her class.

for_sales.sales_text:
1896 Solent One-Design, completely professionally re-built and restored 2009-2010 to the highest specification and similarly maintained by two very careful owners. Coated with epoxy inside and out and finished with epoxy paint and varnish. Mainsail and topsail by Lawrence, headsails by Sanders, spinnakers by Elvstrom and Hyde.

Navigational equipment includes compass, log, depth sounder and chart table. The fully upholstered interior and cockpit cushions were replaced in 2010.

Regularly serviced inboard Yanmar 1GM diesel with new bronze propeller 2010.

Excellent racing record (successes too many to list), a snip at this price.
